conditions.name: Common Cold
conditions.description: A mild viral infection of the upper respiratory tract causing congestion and sore throat.

conditions.name: Viral Fever
conditions.description: A short-term febrile illness caused by common viruses; usually self-limiting.

conditions.name: Influenza (Flu)
conditions.description: A contagious respiratory viral infection with systemic symptoms that can be severe in some people.
precautions: Seek care if shortness of breath or worsening symptoms

conditions.name: COVID-19
conditions.description: Respiratory infection by SARS-CoV-2; severity ranges from mild to life-threatening.
precautions: Seek urgent care for breathing difficulty
medications: Supportive care; antivirals/monoclonal antibodies are doctor-prescribed

conditions.name: Malaria
conditions.description: Mosquito-borne parasitic infection often causing high fevers and cyclical fever patterns; diagnosis requires blood test.
precautions: Get blood tests (malaria smear/rapid test) promptly

conditions.name: Dengue Fever
conditions.description: Mosquito-borne viral infection that can cause hemorrhagic complications and low platelets; needs monitoring.
precautions: Seek medical evaluation and CBC to check platelets
Avoid NSAIDs (ibuprofen/aspirin) due to bleeding risk
medications: Paracetamol for fever; avoid NSAIDs; supportive care in hospital if severe

conditions.name: Yellow Fever
conditions.description: A mosquito-borne viral disease that can cause jaundice and multi-organ failure; severe cases are life-threatening.
precautions: Avoid mosquito exposure; vaccination prevents disease
medications: Supportive care only; no specific antiviral (hospital care required)

conditions.name: Typhoid Fever
conditions.description: Systemic bacterial infection commonly due to Salmonella typhi; typically from contaminated food/water.
precautions: Seek medical testing and hygiene measures

conditions.name: Hepatitis A
conditions.description: Acute viral liver infection usually from contaminated food/water, often causes jaundice.
medications: Supportive care; no specific antiviral (doctor follow-up recommended)

conditions.name: Hepatitis B
conditions.description: Viral infection of the liver that can be acute or chronic; transmitted via blood and bodily fluids.
precautions: Follow-up and monitoring of liver function
medications: Antivirals for chronic cases (doctor-prescribed); supportive care

conditions.name: Hepatitis C
conditions.description: Viral liver infection that often becomes chronic; screening and antiviral treatments exist.

conditions.name: Pneumonia
conditions.description: Infection of the lung air sacs causing cough, fever, and breathing difficulty; can be bacterial or viral.
medications: Antibiotics if bacterial (doctor-prescribed), paracetamol for fever

conditions.name: Bronchitis
conditions.description: Inflammation of bronchial tubes, often follows a viral infection; symptoms include cough and sputum.
medications: Cough syrups (OTC), paracetamol for fever; antibiotics if bacterial (doctor-prescribed)

conditions.name: Tuberculosis (TB)
conditions.description: Bacterial infection (Mycobacterium tuberculosis) primarily affecting lungs but may be systemic; requires long-term treatment.
precautions: Seek immediate medical assessment and testing
Isolation until non-infectious in some cases

conditions.name: Gastroenteritis (Stomach Flu)
conditions.description: Inflammation of stomach and intestines, usually viral, causing vomiting and diarrhea.
precautions: Seek care if dehydrated or bloody stools
medications: Oral rehydration salts (ORS), paracetamol for fever; antiemetics/antidiarrheals per doctor advice

conditions.name: Food Poisoning
conditions.description: Illness after ingesting contaminated food or drink leading to acute GI symptoms.
precautions: Seek care if high fever or persistent symptoms
medications: ORS, paracetamol; activated charcoal only in specific cases (doctor guidance)

conditions.name: Appendicitis
conditions.description: Inflammation of the appendix causing severe localized abdominal pain; may require urgent surgery.
precautions: Do not eat/drink if rupture is suspected
medications: Definitive treatment is surgical (appendectomy); analgesia and antibiotics under medical supervision

conditions.name: Gallstones / Cholelithiasis
conditions.description: Solid deposits in the gallbladder that can cause biliary colic and complications.
precautions: Seek evaluation for recurrent severe pain
medications: Pain relief (OTC) for acute pain; surgery may be recommended (doctor)

conditions.name: Urinary Tract Infection (UTI)
conditions.description: Bacterial infection of the urinary tract causing dysuria and urgency; often needs antibiotics.

conditions.name: Kidney Stones
conditions.description: Hard mineral deposits in kidneys causing severe colicky pain; may require intervention if large.
precautions: Seek medical evaluation for severe pain or obstruction
medications: Pain relievers (OTC), tamsulosin or other therapies may be prescribed by doctor

conditions.name: Migraine
conditions.description: Recurrent, often unilateral throbbing headaches with associated nausea and light sensitivity.
precautions: Rest in a dark quiet place
medications: Paracetamol/ibuprofen for mild attacks; triptans and preventive meds are doctor-prescribed

conditions.name: Tension Headache
conditions.description: Common headache type related to muscle tension and stress.
medications: Paracetamol or NSAIDs (ibuprofen) for pain relief

conditions.name: Meningitis
conditions.description: Inflammation of the brain/spinal cord membranes often due to infection; can be rapidly life-threatening.
precautions: Isolation as required depending on cause
medications: Urgent hospital care; IV antibiotics/antivirals as indicated (doctor-prescribed)

conditions.name: Sepsis / Systemic Infection
conditions.description: Life-threatening organ dysfunction caused by a dysregulated host response to infection.
precautions: Do not delay antibiotics if sepsis suspected
medications: Immediate IV antibiotics and supportive care in hospital (doctor-prescribed)

conditions.name: Allergic Rhinitis (Hay Fever)
conditions.description: Allergic inflammation of nasal mucosa due to pollen, dust, or other allergens.
precautions: Keep indoor air filtered during pollen season

conditions.name: Sinusitis
conditions.description: Inflammation or infection of the sinuses causing facial pressure and nasal symptoms.
precautions: Seek care if symptoms >10 days or severe
medications: Decongestants (short term), paracetamol for pain; antibiotics if bacterial (doctor-prescribed)

conditions.name: Conjunctivitis (Pink Eye)
conditions.description: Inflammation of the conjunctiva due to infection or allergies.
medications: Artificial tears (OTC); antibiotic drops if bacterial (doctor-prescribed)

conditions.name: Otitis Media (Middle Ear Infection)
conditions.description: Infection of the middle ear common in children; causes pain and sometimes discharge.
medications: Paracetamol for pain; antibiotics if bacterial (doctor-prescribed)

conditions.name: Tonsillitis / Pharyngitis
conditions.description: Inflammation of the throat/tonsils often from viral causes but can be bacterial (strep).
precautions: Seek testing if severe or persistent
medications: Paracetamol for pain/fever; antibiotics if bacterial (doctor-prescribed after testing)

conditions.name: Strep Throat
conditions.description: Bacterial throat infection (Group A strep) that generally responds to antibiotics.

conditions.name: Bronchiectasis / chronic bronchitis (COPD)
conditions.description: Chronic obstructive airway disease causing persistent cough and breathlessness; commonly due to smoking or long-term exposure.

conditions.name: Asthma (Acute / Chronic)
conditions.description: Airway hyperreactivity causing episodic wheeze and breathlessness; can be life-threatening in severe attacks.
precautions: Seek emergency care for severe breathing difficulty
medications: Short-acting bronchodilators (salbutamol inhaler; doctor-prescribed), inhaled steroids (doctor-prescribed)

conditions.name: Pleurisy / Pulmonary Embolism (red flag)
conditions.description: Severe causes of chest pain and breathlessness (e.g., pulmonary embolism) requiring urgent evaluation.

conditions.name: Hypertension (High Blood Pressure)
conditions.description: Persistently elevated arterial blood pressure increasing cardiovascular risk over time.

conditions.name: Heart Attack (Myocardial Infarction)
conditions.description: Acute blockage of coronary blood flow leading to heart muscle damage; immediate treatment needed.
precautions: Chew aspirin if advised and not allergic
medications: Emergency hospital interventions (PCI/thrombolysis); aspirin while waiting if appropriate

conditions.name: Stroke (Ischemic / Hemorrhagic)
conditions.description: Acute interruption of blood flow to parts of the brain causing neurological deficits; time-sensitive treatment.

conditions.name: Diabetes Mellitus (Type 2)
conditions.description: Metabolic disorder with high blood sugar due to insulin resistance or deficiency; requires long-term management.
medications: Lifestyle changes; metformin and other medications are doctor-prescribed

conditions.name: Hypoglycemia (Low Blood Sugar)
conditions.description: Dangerously low blood sugar causing neuroglycopenic symptoms; common in diabetics on insulin or sulfonylureas.
medications: Oral glucose or glucose gel; IV dextrose in severe cases (medical supervision)

conditions.name: Iron Deficiency Anemia
conditions.description: Low hemoglobin due to iron deficiency causing tiredness and pallor.
precautions: Check for sources of blood loss
medications: Oral iron supplements (OTC/doctor-prescribed depending on dose)

conditions.name: Normocytic Hypochromic Anemia
conditions.description: A type of anemia where red blood cells are of normal size but have reduced hemoglobin concentration.

conditions.name: Other Microcytic Anemia
conditions.description: Anemia characterized by abnormally small red blood cells often due to iron deficiency or chronic disease.

conditions.name: Leukemia
conditions.description: A type of blood cancer affecting the bone marrow and white blood cells, leading to increased risk of infection and bleeding.

conditions.name: Thrombocytopenia
conditions.description: A condition with abnormally low platelet count, leading to bleeding tendencies.
precautions: Do not use NSAIDs without consultation

conditions.name: Normocytic Normochromic Anemia
conditions.description: Anemia where red blood cells are normal in size and hemoglobin concentration but reduced in number. Often associated with chronic diseases.

conditions.name: Leukemia with Thrombocytopenia
conditions.description: A hematological malignancy presenting with both abnormal white blood cell proliferation and low platelet count.

conditions.name: Macrocytic Anemia
conditions.description: Anemia with abnormally large red blood cells, often due to vitamin B12 or folate deficiency.
precautions: Balanced diet with B12 and folate

conditions.name: Vitamin D Deficiency
conditions.description: Insufficient vitamin D affecting bone health and muscle function.
medications: Vitamin D supplements (OTC or as prescribed)

conditions.name: Arthritis (Osteoarthritis / Rheumatoid features)
conditions.description: Inflammation or wear-and-tear of joints leading to pain and decreased function.
medications: Paracetamol/NSAIDs for pain (NSAIDs per doctor guidance); disease-modifying agents are doctor-prescribed

conditions.name: Gout
conditions.description: Arthritic attacks due to uric acid crystal deposition causing severe pain and swelling.
precautions: Avoid high-purine foods and alcohol during attacks
Seek medical management for recurrent attacks
medications: NSAIDs/colchicine for acute attacks (doctor-prescribed guidance recommended); urate-lowering therapy by doctor

conditions.name: Psoriasis
conditions.description: Chronic autoimmune skin condition with raised scaly plaques.
medications: Topical steroids/coal tar (doctor-prescribed), phototherapy for severe disease

conditions.name: Eczema (Atopic Dermatitis)
conditions.description: Chronic itchy inflammatory skin condition often starting in childhood.
medications: Emollients, topical steroids for flare-ups (doctor guidance)

conditions.name: Ringworm (Tinea / Fungal Skin Infection)
conditions.description: Superficial fungal infection causing ring-shaped itchy patches on skin.
medications: Topical antifungals (OTC); oral antifungals for extensive disease (doctor-prescribed)

conditions.name: Scabies
conditions.description: Infestation of the skin by mites causing severe itch and characteristic burrows.
precautions: Avoid close skin contact until treated

conditions.name: Chickenpox
conditions.description: Viral illness causing itchy blister-like rash; often mild in children but potentially severe in adults.
medications: Paracetamol for fever; calamine lotion and antihistamines for itching; antivirals for severe cases (doctor-prescribed)

conditions.name: Measles
conditions.description: Highly contagious viral infection with fever, cough, conjunctivitis, and a characteristic rash; complications possible.
medications: Supportive care; vitamin A in some pediatric cases per doctor guidance

conditions.name: Mumps
conditions.description: Viral illness causing swollen salivary glands; vaccination prevents most cases.

conditions.name: Hand-Foot-and-Mouth Disease
conditions.description: Common viral illness in children causing mouth ulcers and skin rash.
medications: Paracetamol for fever; topical analgesics for mouth pain

conditions.name: Meningitis (bacterial/viral)
conditions.description: Inflammation of the meninges often due to infection; can rapidly become life-threatening.
precautions: Do not delay antibiotics if bacterial suspected
medications: Hospital IV antibiotics/antivirals and supportive care (doctor-prescribed)

conditions.name: Severe Dehydration (from GI loss)
conditions.description: Critical fluid and electrolyte deficit requiring prompt rehydration, sometimes IV in hospital.
medications: Oral rehydration solutions; IV fluids in hospital

conditions.name: Urinary Retention / Acute Obstructive Uropathy (red flag)
conditions.description: Inability to empty bladder often requiring catheterization and urgent assessment.
precautions: Do not attempt home catheterization without training
medications: Relief measures and urological interventions by physician

conditions.name: Depression (Major Depressive Disorder)
conditions.description: Mood disorder causing persistent low mood and loss of interest; severe cases risk self-harm.

conditions.name: Anxiety Disorder
conditions.description: Excessive and persistent worry or fear interfering with daily life.

conditions.name: Insomnia (sleep disturbance)
conditions.description: Trouble initiating or maintaining sleep leading to daytime impairment.
medications: Short-term sleep aids under doctor guidance; CBT for insomnia recommended

conditions.name: Pancreatitis
conditions.description: Inflammation of the pancreas often causing severe abdominal pain and systemic illness.
medications: Hospital management; analgesia and supportive care (doctor-prescribed)

conditions.name: Thyroid Disorders (Hypothyroidism)
conditions.description: Underactive thyroid causing metabolic slowing; diagnosis via blood tests.

conditions.name: Kidney Disease (Chronic Kidney Disease)
conditions.description: Progressive loss of kidney function leading to fluid and metabolic disturbances.
medications: Medications to control BP and progression (doctor-prescribed)

conditions.name: Severe Allergic Reaction / Anaphylaxis
conditions.description: Life-threatening systemic allergic reaction requiring immediate treatment (epinephrine).
precautions: Carry epinephrine autoinjector if at risk
medications: Intramuscular epinephrine immediately (emergency); hospital support required

conditions.name: Epilepsy / Seizure Disorder
conditions.description: Neurological condition with recurrent unprovoked seizures requiring specialist management.
